<p>12 weeks full-time. FAST is presently offered in both Semester 1 (February to June) and Semester 2 (July to November) at Mt Helen &amp; Gippsland Campuses. Semester 2 only at Horsham. Part Time study may be available, subject to negotiation with program co-ordinator.</p>
<p>The exam takes approximately three and a half hours to complete.</p>

Three years part-time - 24 weeks trade training on campus spread over three years (8 blocks per year).<br />

Program.Award: Certificate III in Painting and Decorating
Program.Length: <p>On-site training and assessment will be negotiated with apprentices and employers, to provide a flexible and inclusive training program. Competency based completion (CBC) means that the 3 year program may be completed more quickly.</p>
This course is delivered in 9 one week blocks per year for 3 years.

<p>Three years study. This is a blended program offered with a combination of workplace and trade school training and assessment. Competency based completion (CBC) means that study may be completed more quickly.</p>

Program.Award: Certificate III in Retail Baking (Combined) - Apprenticeship
Certificate III in Retail Baking (Cake & Pastry) - Apprenticeship
Certificate III in Engineering - Mechanical Trade
Program.Length: Combination of classroom delivered theory and prac plus 'On The Job' training, normally taken over three years.

Program.Award: Certificate III in Engineering - Fabrication Trade
Program.Length: Combination of classroom delivered theory and prac plus 'On The Job' training, normally taken over three years.
Training is conducted through the University's horticulture facility, corner of Gregory and Gillies Streets, Ballarat on a full-time basis for 18 months or a part-time basis in the day or evening.

<p>Non apprentice students may study full time for 12 months with part-time study for selected units. Training is conducted through the Rural Sciences Skills Centreof Gillies and Gregory Street, Ballarat and may include flexible workplace training and assessment. Traineeship study is available for students with a valid training agreement.</p>

Program.Award: Certificate III in Automotive Mechanical Technology - Light Vehicle
Program.Length: The course uses a self-paced objective-based syllabus that allows you to progress at your own rate and to start the course at any time throughout the year without being disadvantaged. Apprentices can complete all of their training in this course at either the SMB Campus (Ballarat) or Horsham Campus. Total Nominal hours - 1000 (340 per year for three years).<br />

Program.Award: Certificate III in Automotive Sales - Parts Interpreting
Program.Length: Three years Apprenticeship within a workplace. Approximately 4 hours per week undertaken on the job or at the SMB Campus.

Program.Award: Certificate III in Automotive Mechanical Technology - Heavy Vehicle Road Transport
Program.Length: <p>One year, This course uses a self-paced objective-based syllabus, which allows you to progress at your own rate and to start the course at any time throughout the year without being disadvantaged. Apprentices attend training at either the Horsham Campus or the SMB Campus (Ballarat) for Four (Ballarat) or five (Horsham / Melton) consecutive days for up to eight weeks each year over a twelve month period. Total hours - 415 Hrs</p>

Program.Award: Certificate III in Automotive Mechanical Technology-Heavy Vehicle Mobile Equipment
Program.Length: <p>One year, This course uses a self-paced objective-based syllabus, which allows you to progress at your own rate and to start the course at any time throughout the year without being disadvantaged. Apprentices attend training at either the Horsham Campus or the SMB Campus (Ballarat) for Four (Ballarat) or five (Horsham / Melton) consecutive days for up to eight weeks each year over a twelve month period. Total hours - 415 Hrs</p>

<p>Three years study. This is a blended program offered with a combination of workplace and trade school training and assessment. Competency based completion (CBC) means that study may be completed more quickly.</p>

Program.Length: <p>This is a self-paced competency-based program that can be completed part-time, via flexible delivery format (with the theory component being completed at home and the practical component on-campus) or via block release. Program.Length: <p>On-campus at Mt Helen (Ballarat): Full-time (6 months) on-campus <em>or</em></p> <p>Flexible delivery at Mt Helen: Study Tuesday evenings with independent study completed using printed material and online study. Completion of the program using this method takes 9 months <em>or</em></p> <p>Full-time (9 months) via Distance Learning through the Horsham Campus. Distance Learning students are required to attend three weekend workshops each year at Horsham campus.</p> <p>The course also includes two Practical Placement components, which are completed in a registered Children's Service. Traineeships may be available for those eligible. Further information about Traineeships is available by contacting staff listed under 'Enquiries'</p>

Program.Length: <p>Can be studied full time and completed in 1 year. Study is via weekend workshops and indepedent study. To complete in 1 yr attend 2 weekend workshops per month. Number of workshops depends on how many units are studied part time.</p> <p> </p>
<p>Two years full-time at Mt Helen Campus (Ballarat) - Semester 1 commencement only.</p>

Program.Campuses: Mt Helen Campus (Ballarat),Primary Industry Training Centre (Ballarat)
Program.Length: <p>The Diploma of Sustainability is intended to complement material studied in another course (diploma level or above). The program is delivered over two vacation blocks (Mon - Fri 9:30am - 4:30pm) at the Primary Industries Training - Centre Gillies St campususually February &amp; July. These are supported by online learning resources and activities.</p>
<p>Minimum of 3 years to a maximum of 4 years (full-time equivalent)</p>

<p>Enrolment can be on a full-time or part-time basis. The DBA degree is expected to be completed in 3 years full-time (or the equivalent in part-time study). It may be possible to meet degree requirements over a shorter or longer period of enrolment. Students work under the supervision of a supervisor registered on the University Register of Supervisors on the recommendation of the School.</p>
12 months part time or 6 months full time
